qas.question: Where did the depression cause negative effects?
How much did international trade fall?
What happened to construction during the Depression?
How far did crop prices fall?

context: The depression had devastating effects in <a0_0>virtually every country<a0_0/>, rich or poor. International trade plunged <a1_0>by half to two-thirds,<a1_0/> as did personal income, tax revenue, prices and profits. Cities all around the world were hit hard, especially those dependent on heavy industry. Construction was <a2_0>virtually halted in many countries<a2_0/>. Farming and rural areas suffered as crop prices fell by roughly <a3_0>60 percent<a3_0/>. Facing plummeting demand with few alternate sources of jobs, areas dependent on primary sector industries suffered the most.
